description._content:
Correct the places hierarchy for all the photos for a user at a given latitude, longitude and accuracy.

Batch corrections are processed in a delayed queue so it may take a few minutes before the changes are reflected in a user's photos.

argument.name: api_key
argument._content: Your API application key. See here for more details.

argument.name: lat
argument._content: The latitude of the photos to be update whose valid range is -90 to 90. Anything more than 6 decimal places will be truncated.

argument.name: lon
argument._content: The longitude of the photos to be updated whose valid range is -180 to 180. Anything more than 6 decimal places will be truncated.

argument.name: accuracy
argument._content: Recorded accuracy level of the photos to be updated. World level is 1, Country is ~3, Region ~6, City ~11, Street ~16. Current range is 1-16. Defaults to 16 if not specified.

argument.name: place_id
argument._content: A Flickr Places ID. (While optional, you must pass either a valid Places ID or a WOE ID.)

argument.name: woe_id
argument._content: A Where On Earth (WOE) ID. (While optional, you must pass either a valid Places ID or a WOE ID.)

error._content: Some or all of the required arguments were not supplied.
An invalid Places (or WOE) ID was passed with the API call.

error.message: No photos geotagged at that location
error._content: There were no geotagged photos found for the authed user at the supplied latitude, longitude and accuracy.
SSL is required to access the Flickr API.
The call required signing but no signature was sent.
The login details or auth token passed were invalid.

error.message: User not logged in / Insufficient permissions
error._content: The method requires user authentication but the user was not logged in, or the authenticated method call did not have the required permissions.
The API key passed was not valid or has expired.
The requested service is temporarily unavailable.
The requested operation failed due to a temporary issue.
The requested response format was not found.
The requested method was not found.
The SOAP envelope send in the request could not be parsed.
The XML-RPC request document could not be parsed.
One or more arguments contained a URL that has been used for abuse on Flickr.
